  • Deprecated Interfaces 
    Interface and Description
    com.restfb.experimental.api.Applications
    com.restfb.experimental.api.Comments
    com.restfb.experimental.api.Groups
    com.restfb.LegacyFacebookClient
    The old Rest API is deprecated with the Graph API 2.0, please migrate your code to the Graph API
    com.restfb.experimental.api.Pages
    com.restfb.experimental.api.Posts
    com.restfb.experimental.api.Users
  • Deprecated Classes 
    Class and Description
    com.restfb.types.ads.AdGroup
    com.restfb.types.ads.AdTag
    with Marketing API version 2.4 use AdLabel instead
    com.restfb.experimental.api.impl.ApiFactory
    com.restfb.experimental.api.impl.ApplicationsImpl
    com.restfb.types.Checkin.Place
    As of release 1.6.10, replaced by Place.
    com.restfb.types.Checkin.Place.Location
    As of release 1.6.10, replaced by Location.
    com.restfb.experimental.api.impl.CommentsImpl
    com.restfb.DefaultLegacyFacebookClient
    The old Rest API is deprecated with the Graph API 2.0, please migrate your code to the Graph API
    com.restfb.experimental.api.Facebook
    com.restfb.experimental.api.impl.GroupsImpl
    com.restfb.experimental.api.impl.PagesImpl
    com.restfb.types.Post.Place
    As of release 1.6.10, replaced by Location.
    com.restfb.types.Post.Privacy
    use Privacy instead
    com.restfb.experimental.api.impl.PostsImpl
    com.restfb.types.Question
    com.restfb.types.QuestionOption
    removed after Graph API 1.0
    com.restfb.types.StatusMessage
    com.restfb.types.User.Work
    use WorkExperience instead
    com.restfb.experimental.api.impl.UsersImpl
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    com.restfb.types.Video.addComment(Comment)
    com.restfb.LegacyFacebookClient.execute(String, String, Class<T>, Parameter...)
    Use LegacyFacebookClient.execute(String, Class, Parameter...) instead. Facebook is moving to OAuth and will stop supporting the old session key authentication scheme soon.
    com.restfb.LegacyFacebookClient.execute(String, String, Parameter...)
    Use LegacyFacebookClient.execute(String, Parameter...) instead. Facebook is moving to OAuth and will stop supporting the old session key authentication scheme soon.
    com.restfb.LegacyFacebookClient.executeForList(String, String, Class<T>, Parameter...)
    Use LegacyFacebookClient.executeForList(String, Class, Parameter...) instead. Facebook is moving to OAuth and will stop supporting the old session key authentication scheme soon.
    com.restfb.FacebookClient.executeFqlMultiquery(Map<String, String>, Class<T>, Parameter...)
    With the deprecation of Graph API 2.0 (August 7, 2016) FQL is not longer supported, change this asap
    com.restfb.FacebookClient.executeFqlQuery(String, Class<T>, Parameter...)
    With the deprecation of Graph API 2.0 (August 7, 2016) FQL is not longer supported, change this asap
    com.restfb.FacebookClient.executeMultiquery(Map<String, String>, Class<T>, Parameter...)
    As of 1.6.12, prefer FacebookClient.executeFqlMultiquery(Map, Class, Parameter...) because it connects to the Graph API FQL endpoint instead of the legacy FQL endpoint.
    com.restfb.DefaultFacebookClient.executeMultiquery(Map<String, String>, Class<T>, Parameter...)
    com.restfb.LegacyFacebookClient.executeMultiquery(Map<String, String>, String, Class<T>, Parameter...)
    Use LegacyFacebookClient.executeMultiquery(Map, Class, Parameter...) instead. Facebook is moving to OAuth and will stop supporting the old session key authentication scheme soon.
    com.restfb.FacebookClient.executeQuery(String, Class<T>, Parameter...)
    As of 1.6.12, prefer FacebookClient.executeFqlQuery(String, Class, Parameter...) because it connects to the Graph API FQL endpoint instead of the legacy FQL endpoint.
    com.restfb.DefaultFacebookClient.executeQuery(String, Class<T>, Parameter...)
    com.restfb.types.Subscription.getCompatFields()
    use fields instead and change your code to work with SubscriptionField objects.
    com.restfb.types.Video.getMessage()
    FB seems to have removed this field.
    com.restfb.types.Photo.getPosition()
    Facebook will start returning 0 for this field starting on October 3, 2012.
    com.restfb.types.webhook.messaging.MessageItem.getSeq()
    https://messengerblog.com/platform-updates/introducing-messenger-platform-v1-3-and-new-ways-to-drive-the-conversation/ "Developers who previously relied on using seq ID for deduping can use mid instead, and those who were using it for ordering purposes can use timestamp instead."
    com.restfb.types.Photo.getSource()
    Use images field instead
    com.restfb.types.User.getUsername()
    since graph api 2.0
    com.restfb.types.Comment.isCanComment()
    use Comment.getCanComment() instead
    com.restfb.types.Comment.isCanHide()
    use Comment.getCanHide() instead
    com.restfb.types.webhook.FeedPostValue.isHidden()
    use FeedPostValue.getIsHidden() instead
    com.restfb.types.Message.ImageData.isRenderAsSticker()
    use Message#getRenderAsSticker() instead
    com.restfb.types.Video.removeComment(Comment)
    com.restfb.types.Subscription.setCompatFields(List<String>)
    use fields instead and change your code to work with SubscriptionField objects.
    com.restfb.types.Video.setMessage(String)
    FB seems to have removed this field.
    com.restfb.types.Photo.setPosition(Integer)
    Facebook will start returning 0 for this field starting on October 3, 2012.
    com.restfb.types.webhook.messaging.MessageItem.setSeq(Long)
    https://messengerblog.com/platform-updates/introducing-messenger-platform-v1-3-and-new-ways-to-drive-the-conversation/ "Developers who previously relied on using seq ID for deduping can use mid instead, and those who were using it for ordering purposes can use timestamp instead."
    com.restfb.types.Photo.setSource(String)
    Use images field instead
    com.restfb.types.User.setUsername(String)
    since graph api 2.0
    com.restfb.BinaryAttachment.with(String, InputStream)
    use the stream-less API passing a byte[] for data
    com.restfb.BinaryAttachment.with(String, InputStream, String)
    use the stream-less API passing a byte[] for data instead
    com.restfb.BinaryAttachment.with(String, String, InputStream)
    use the stream-less API passing a byte[] for data
    com.restfb.BinaryAttachment.with(String, String, InputStream, String)
    use the stream-less API passing a byte[] for data
  • Deprecated Constructors 
    Constructor and Description
    com.restfb.DefaultFacebookClient()
    As of release 1.7.1, replaced by DefaultFacebookClient.DefaultFacebookClient(com.restfb.Version)
    com.restfb.DefaultFacebookClient(String)
    As of release 1.7.1 replaced by DefaultFacebookClient.DefaultFacebookClient(java.lang.String, com.restfb.Version)
    com.restfb.DefaultFacebookClient(String, String)
    As of release 1.7.1, replaced by DefaultFacebookClient.DefaultFacebookClient(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, com.restfb.Version)
    com.restfb.DefaultFacebookClient(String, WebRequestor, JsonMapper)
    As of release 1.7.1, replaced by DefaultFacebookClient.DefaultFacebookClient(java.lang.String, com.restfb.WebRequestor, com.restfb.JsonMapper, com.restfb.Version)
    com.restfb.DefaultLegacyFacebookClient(String, String)
    You should use DefaultLegacyFacebookClient.DefaultLegacyFacebookClient(String) instead. Facebook is moving to OAuth and will stop supporting the old authentication scheme soon.
    com.restfb.DefaultLegacyFacebookClient(String, String, WebRequestor, JsonMapper)
    You should use DefaultLegacyFacebookClient.DefaultLegacyFacebookClient(String, WebRequestor, JsonMapper) instead. Facebook is moving to OAuth and will stop supporting the old authentication scheme soon.
    com.restfb.types.send.QuickReply(String, String, String)
    use constructor without contenttype instead. If using content type 'text' use QuickReply.QuickReply(String,String) for 'location' use QuickReply.QuickReply()
  • Deprecated Enum Constants 
    Enum Constant and Description
    com.restfb.scope.ExtendedPermissions.MANAGE_NOTIFICATIONS
    Not usable since Graph API 2.4. If you use the Graph API before 2.4 ignore the deprecation warning
    com.restfb.scope.ExtendedPermissions.READ_FRIENDLISTS
    not usable since Graph API 2.3, use READ_CUSTOM_FRIENDLISTS instead. If you use the Graph API before 2.3 ignore the deprecation warning
    com.restfb.scope.ExtendedPermissions.READ_MAILBOX
    Not usable since Graph API 2.4. If you use the Graph API before 2.4 ignore the deprecation warning
    com.restfb.scope.ExtendedPermissions.READ_STREAM
    Not usable since Graph API 2.4. If you use the Graph API before 2.4 ignore the deprecation warning
    com.restfb.scope.UserDataPermissions.USER_ACTIVITIES
    com.restfb.scope.UserDataPermissions.USER_GROUPS
    Not usable since Graph API 2.4. If you use the Graph API before 2.4 ignore the deprecation warning
    com.restfb.scope.UserDataPermissions.USER_INTERESTS
    com.restfb.scope.UserDataPermissions.USER_STATUS
    Not usable since Graph API 2.4. If you use the Graph API before 2.4 ignore the deprecation warning. If you are calling the endpoint /{user-id}/posts or /{user-id}/feed, ask for the user_posts permission instead (only v2.3 or older).
    com.restfb.Version.VERSION_1_0
    use Version.VERSION_2_3 instead
    com.restfb.Version.VERSION_2_0
    use Version.VERSION_2_3 instead
    com.restfb.Version.VERSION_2_1
    use Version.VERSION_2_3 instead
    com.restfb.Version.VERSION_2_2
    use Version.VERSION_2_3 instead
